content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was fun. Different solutions possible.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: this is a fun clash of code puzzle with a good explanation and test cases

It's strange that the result is rounded, especially since there are different rounding rules when halfway. Specifically, these are to round up in this scenario, to round away from zero, or to round to even. Worse, the second test All Unique is the only case where this applies. It's not checked for in the validators.

You could just get rid of the rounding rule, by ensuring that the result is an integer which does not need rounding, or by asking for twice the median, or by multiplying the result by e.g. 10, or by always using an odd number of values so that the median never needs to be computed as an average. Or you could just ask for the result unrounded. Regardless, test any special cases.

If you keep the rounding rule, check that rounding is correctly applied in later rather than earlier tests and validators. You would also need to state how to round unless the results would always be rounded the same way regardless. E.g. 73.5 will round to 74 under any method.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It has a ton of aura. So much aura like Gojo.

Goal
* Please mention the definition of median.

Input
* Please add a space after each colon instead of before it.

Constraints
* Please do not format the numbers as variables. Only variable names should be formatted as variables.

* Please revise the cases and/or the limits to reflect the cases more accurately (e.g. N is never greater than 10, and a[i] is always between -10 and 10 right now).

Cases
* Please revise the cases so that each pair of test and validator are *different and similar but not the same*.

Stub generator
* Please change Line 2 to:
loopline N a:int

Thanks.
Thanks, rounding has been removed now.
